meanings.definition: Done as a formality or for the sake of appearances.
meanings.sent1: The proforma meeting was just for show.
meanings.sent2: The proforma handshake was brief and insincere.
meanings.sent3: The proforma smile on his face didn't reach his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The proforma decorations added no real value to the event.

meanings.definition: A document or statement provided in advance of a transaction for informational purposes.
meanings.sent1: She reviewed the proforma before signing the contract.
meanings.sent2: The proforma included details about the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The proforma highlighted the key points of the agreement.
meanings.sent4: The proforma served as a helpful guide for the negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The proforma clarified the terms of the deal for both parties.

meanings.sent1: The proforma listed the estimated costs of the services.
meanings.sent2: He requested a proforma to plan the budget for the project.
meanings.sent3: The proforma surprised him with its detailed breakdown.
meanings.sent4: The proforma invoice was sent to the client for approval.
meanings.sent5: The proforma bill helped them anticipate the expenses ahead.
